column2: MISSISSIPPI DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Mississippi
column6: MS

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. You are considered to be driving under the influence when your blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is ____ or more.
2. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column6: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.
column8: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column6: Do not turn right.
column8: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 4. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: quickly change speed or lane position.
column6: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.

column2: 5. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column6: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 6. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column4: sharp turn
column6: no U-turn

column2: 7. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column6: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.

column2: 8. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column6: you must do it.
column8: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 9. Sudden wind gusts on highways:
column4: only affect large vehicles.
column6: can cause one to lose control of their vehicle.
column8: are generally caused by dust and dirt blowing around.

column2: 10. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 11. A good rule of thumb for drivers sharing the road with a truck is:
column4: always try to stay alongside a truck, but never drive right behind it.
column6: it is better to drive to the immediate right of the cab.
column8: if you can’t see the truck driver in their side mirror, they can’t see you.

column2: 12. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: in both directions may pass.
column6: next to the broken line may pass.
column8: next to the solid line may pass.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
column6: Do not enter

column2: 14. This sign indicates:
column4: A slow-moving vehicle
column6: A no-passing zone

column2: 15. Reaction time is slower:
column4: after drinking alcohol.
column6: after sleeping.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Double curve ahead
column6: Winding road

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Lane reduction - the right lane ends soon
column6: Highway entrance ramp ahead
column8: Lane reduction - the left lane ends soon

column2: 18. Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
column4: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.
column6: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.
column8: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.

column2: 19. When the road is slippery you should:
column4: slow and pro-ceed with caution.
column6: decrease the following distance.

column2: 20. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors are useless.
column6: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 21. When you see this sign you should:
column4: watch for traffic to the right.
column6: turn right.

column2: 22. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: 3 hours.
column6: one hour.

column2: 23. A crosswalk is:
column4: an area designated for blind persons.
column6: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.

column2: 24. A driver who's being passed on the right and the left by many vehicles while driving in the center lane of an highway should:
column4: move to the lane on their left.
column6: take the next exit.
column8: move to the lane on their right.

column2: 25. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: road rage
column6: excessive driving

column2: 26. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: obey signals from crossing guards.
column6: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 27. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Make eye contact.
column6: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column8: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column2: 28. When changing lanes, drivers should never:
column4: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column6: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.

column2: 29. When turning left at an intersection:
column4: oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.
column6: you should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: you should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 30. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
